English Title:
BA230022, Invitation to Tender (ITT) for Standing Offer Agreement for Laboratory, Soil and Materials Engineering, Geoenvironmental and Building Science Services.


English Description:
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is calling for abbreviated proposals from consulting firms to award a Standing Offer Agreement (SOA) to provide “â/ànd when requiredÂ¬◨ the following professional services at the Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Bagotville: 

	Material Analysis: soil, concrete, mortar, bituminous, Soil Sample Analysis, Inspection, and monitoring of steel structures: welding, verticality, bolting.

Information provided by the Proponents will be evaluated using the established criteria in the ITT. The objective of this ITT is to select two proponents with the highest total scores.

The SOA will be for a period of one (1) year with a maximum estimated value of $ 1,000,000.00. If mutually agreeable between the Consultant and DCC, the SOA may be extended for up to four (4) additional year period and increased in the order of $1,000,000.00 at any time for each additional period. Call-ups under the SOA are expected to be valued between $ 5,000.00 and $ 25,000.00; the maximum value of a call-up under the SOA is $ 100,000.00. Refer to the ITT document for additional information.

This solicitation is being conducted in accordance with the requirements set out in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Chapter Nineteen of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA).

Firms that consider themselves qualified to provide these services are invited to submit their Abbreviated Proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System on or before the closing date and time indicated on the Electronic Bidding System.

The selected consultant will be required to hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS), issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP) within Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC).
Details concerning the Security Requirements for this project are identified in the ITT documents.
Proponents who address their questions to anyone other than the point of contact during the solicitation period may, for that reason alone, be disqualified.

Please note that the preliminary results for this solicitation will be available on MERX.

Proponents can obtain contract award results from the DCC Website at Contract Activity - Defence Construction Canada (dcc-cdc.gc.ca)

## Tender Announcement for Laboratory Services

**Notice Details**

* Reference Number: MX-43034042413
* Solicitation Number: BA230022_80516
* Publication Date: 2024-02-13
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-03-19T14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 2024-03-19
* Tender Status: Expired

**Contracting Entity**

* Name: Defence Construction Canada (DCC)
* Address: 350 Albert St, 19th floor, Ottawa, ON K1A 0K3, Canada
* Contact: Jacob Lachapelle, jacob.lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca, 343-550-4560

**Solicitation Overview**

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites consulting firms to submit abbreviated proposals for a Standing Offer Agreement (SOA) to provide laboratory services for soil and materials, geoenvironmental, and building sciences at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Bagotville.

**Services Required**

The selected contractor will provide the following services:

* Material analysis (soils, concrete, mortar, bituminous)
* Soil sample analysis
* Inspection and monitoring of steel structures (welding, verticality, bolting)
* Granulometry testing (MG56, MG112, CG14)
* Proctor testing (MG56, MG112, CG14)
* Compressive testing (cement, mortar, aggregate)
* Analytical testing (petroleum hydrocarbons, metals, PFAS)

**Contract Terms**

* The SOA will be for a period of one (1) year with a maximum estimated value of $1,000,000.00.
* The contract may be extended for up to four (4) additional year periods, with a maximum estimated value of $4,000,000.00 for each extension.
* The contractor will be required to hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP) within Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC).

**Evaluation Criteria**

Proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical expertise
* Past experience
* Pricing
* Security clearance

**Submissions and Uploads**

Proponents are invited to submit their abbreviated proposals through the MERX Electronic Bidding System on or before the closing date and time. The tender documents and evaluation criteria are available on the MERX website.
